name: Floodplain Complexity (side channels/oxbows/wetlands)
functionStatement: Frequent overbank flows reduce flood peaks, support riparian vegetation, create off-channel refugia, and extend nutrient processing time.
descriptionMarkdown: Floodplain/off-channel features stay diverse/connected at moderate floods, reflecting minimal loss.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Delineate side channels, oxbows, and wetlands and assess connectivity during moderate floods using field checks and available mapping.

inputs.label: Floodplain Complexity (side channels/oxbows/wetlands)
inputs.helpMarkdown: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Multiple active features connected during moderate floods and consistent with historical complexity. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Partial complexity remains with some features truncated or partially isolated. / Most off-channel features are lost or only minimally connected. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Floodplain is simplified or leveed with little or no off-channel function remaining. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)
